data.title: Update civilian.yaml
data.body: Remove bib from Oil Derrick as it caused graphical errors on some maps where it was placed near terrain obstacles. (The bib being on top of a river for example)

data.title: GPS satellite bug
data.body:
The Allied Tech center continues to "build" the GPS satellite when base is low powered.

It should be onhold like the nuke if low power.

data.title: Renamed some project files for IP clearance
data.body: to avoid unnecessary "Command & Conquer" trademarks that are used for that free to play game currently in the making which builds heavily on it's branding. "Tiberian Dawn" and "Red Alert" itself are not registered by EA without the C&C prefix.

data.title: Disabled AttackWander for ants and zombies
data.body: closes #3565

data.title: WrapText should split individual words that are by themselves too long to fit on a line
data.body:
This bug results in long words disappearing.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/883630-wraptext-should-split-individual-words-that-are-by-themselves-too-long-to-fit-on-a-line?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Revert AI target filtering
data.body: This is the cause of the recent behavior regressions. #3763 will need to be reopened, but that is a lower priority bug.

data.title: AI Fixup
data.body:
Most of our current AI bugs seem to come from one function (`GroundUnitsAttackMoveState.Tick`).

This rewrites the function to be clearer, faster, and hopefully bug free.

data.title: Exception messages should be logged in English on non-English systems
Bundled native Windows dependencies
data.body: This makes both compiling and installing #3765 a lot simpler.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.title: My take on Single Player
data.body:
Gonna keep this tight. More detail can be explained later.
1. Have a button for Singleplayer mission.
2. Have 2 way to play the campaign (Classic / OpenRA Enchanted)
3. In enchanted mode, make ALL campaign maps co-op (Example below)

Classic mode should be straight port from RA1 with as little changes as possible (Bug fixes and new functions like wall building made easy should still be ingame)

Enchanted mode should add both more detail and maybe even more objectives or other actions (like Tanya fighting of forces in Allied 1 Mission)

2 Example of Enchanted missions.

Allies 1.
Player one controls Tanya (And maybe the starting units)
Player two controls either starting units except tanya, or the reinforcement cruisers.

Soviet 1.
Player one controls the Yak's.
Player two controls all reinforcements that are dropped on the other side of the destroyed bridge.

The enchanted version should also add some more map detail, i.ex. Soviet 1 mission, add some sandbags wall or something, a samsite? Forward command post without the "explore whole map"-thingy, maybe a guard dog and some more soldiers, stuff you cant actully use in the mission but to make it look more like a base and less like... 3 airstrips and 2 powerplants with a radar.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/883632-my-take-on-single-player?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Global Conquest mode
data.body:
ok this one its huge but its worth it for many reasons!
walk with me on this one

imagine this

![globalcon](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5400487/1097199/ce400890-170c-11e3-9270-efa94c79af4b.JPG)

1) a map with regions made by shp files(so you can attack them)

2) turn based movement  

3) battles start in a battle map NOT in the global map

4) battle maps are unique for each region

5) armys per region or continental (like north america= +1 army) or user defined 36 per user + continental.or 2 per user you know user\server defined ect..

6) diplomacy for traitors like hasan (tiberian sun) or civilians,mutants,sadukar. give regions to other players. transfer money or units by convoys,
every map the convoy passes Through  is one turn for the convoy to reach the region. (this could be a mission for the enemy to stop it or steel it.) or even allow to other allied players to build in the same region.

7) dynamic join ect. players that have armys in neighborhood regions can enter the battlemap in the middle of the battle after a specific time and aid or divide other players

8) reinforcements like above but the army is yours, builded by you, controled by you.

9) armys that enter the  battle map are changing region the global map as well and stays ther after battle IF are still alive

10) battle maps that have 2 or more winner allied players on them are changing owner by vote or can have it together (2 or more bases per battlemap defined by the server) EXCEPT if the battle was defensive in that situation the region stays to the defender allied player

11) the battle maps must have entry points for the enemy\allied forces to join in
and that can be the 4 corners and the 2 vertical  2 horizontal (ect +) lines in the battlemap based on the region map

12) to enter a battlemap that have sea saround it you must have transport ship and that means you need a shipyard in a region that have sea on it.
except if the map got an entry point that connected to the land

13) after battle you can revisit the battle map and build buildings and defenses(the number of buildings that you can build per turn is specified by the server)

14) you CANT build everywhere in the battle map in the re-visit mode, every map will have starting point ware the bases of the owner and his allies will stay and build in a limited space around the starting point. this space is defined by the battlemap arthur /maker/creator.

15) in the global map the user will be able to make build units for defense(the number is defined by the server per region) in regions but the specified build region must have the appropriate building to do so.

16) you can occupy regions with only troops but you understand the minus on that.

17)  players can name ther bases in the global map

18) you need to make a research in the global map to have new buildings and units and super weapons ect... 

19) regions=shp will have the color of the owner or server defined color

20) players names will shown in the owning regions.

21) in the global map you will able to see your units per region money tech ect...

22) money will rise every turn by 3 ways 
A) specified by the server ex. for every region +1000 money per turn
B) the above plus the money you have in a battle after you win (if the above set to zero you will have to do battles to earn money)
G) you will earn money per turn by having a continent(europe,africa,ect) under your\allied control

23) the global conquest mode can be used for making singleplayer campaigns too!
with films and staff.

24) films may be add  in multiplayer too for coop games "player vs scenario\AI" or "players vs Players scenario"  films can showed up at the start of a battle in win or loose.

25) coop games will have the option of losing a region permanently or be able to re-take or it can be for specific regions.

26) a game save option must added for global conquest and for battle maps (revisit mode is a save but it can be loaded in any time from the global map with out interrupting the global turn and its used to store ware the buildings\units  will be in the next battle(its not something that will load a saved battle! its like a map editor,fro placing units\buildings per turn)

27) this can be used for avery game ra td ts ra2 dune!

i am not a programmer and i will not be i have try it but dint work out many times!!!
so dont ask me to make it! or learn C#

i hope this will be added but i know it will take a long long long long long time to be added or it will never added...

data.title: old stile colors
data.body:
do you remember tiberium dawn coloring theme in the single player?
NOD got red color for buildings and white for units except the harverster or captured buildings from GDI.

what i whantd is this:
HARV:
         colorpicker:   userB        (1)
         specialcolor: fulse          (2)
              specialc: red             (3)

explanation:
1)  what color this units\bulding is using? userB or userU 
userB is the color of the buildings. that the player have chose in the options menu
userU is the color of the units. that the player have chose in the options menu
ect... from now on the player will have the option of 2 colors one for units one for buildings to chose from.

2)is this unit\building use a special color no matter what the user have chose from the game options?

3)the definition of the color from the specialcolor label
it could be name tag Red,Green,ect... or numbers 255,10,100 more like it.

and all that can be an option like a check box 
and i say that for the people that dont like the idea.
but i like it and i am sure that many others do like it.
i want to play a multiplayer and a singleplayer like this why? coz i like it. 
and this one is not a censer for the project ChrisF!!!  lol

data.title: Idea for making radar useful to keep powered.
data.body:
Radar should give the ability to place waypoints on the map that would be visible to allies. It would help coordinate attacks and such.'

You can place a small marker on the play-field, and maybe even type a small note that would pop-up when it was moused over.

Though, people will probably still power down their radar anyway.

data.title: Fast repost.
data.body:
Shift + up should be able to be used as a fast repost (like irc).

However if we add this function we might need to add some anti-spam function that wont let you repost the same line in more then x seconds.

data.title: Team chat for spectators.
data.body:
Best - idea - ever.

So spectators can put bets on players and stuffs. :D

data.title: Change of server options should output a message in chat
data.body: e.g. if someone activates "debug menu" a message in the chat should warn the other players.

data.body: http://pastebin.com/HN8i75gA

data.title: Eliminated usage of default parameters.
data.body: Remove C# 4.0 feature to maintain c# 3.5 support.

data.title: New Story-Mode menu section
data.body:
I have found out that OpenRA leak of a separated menu voice option, for who is interested on the Story-Mode/Single-Mode gameplay. At the moment, there's some sort of workaround, that put this game mode aside and it's difficult to notice it.

Maybe, having it on a dedicated menu option (like in the original C&C), this would help people not only playing with such missions, but even to get busy on producing more single-maps or maybe, converting the C&C ones, for the OpenRA engine.

data.title: 0902 System.IO.IOException
data.body:
Playing on dedicated against AI's. Crash right before 10 min.

Exception of type `System.IO.IOException`: Kan ikke skrive data til transporttilkoblingen: En eksisterende tilkobling ble tvangslukket av den eksterne verten.
Inner Exception of type `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException`: En eksisterende tilkobling ble tvangslukket av den eksterne verten
     ved System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Send(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size, SocketFlags socketFlags)
   ved System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size)
   ved System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size)
   ved System.IO.MemoryStream.WriteTo(Stream stream)
   ved OpenRA.Network.NetworkConnection.Send(Byte[] packet)
   ved OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Send(Int32 frame, List`1 orders)
   ved OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Send(Int32 frame, List`1 orders)
   ved OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick()
   ved OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   ved OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort)
   ved OpenRA.Game.Run()
   ved OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   ved OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

http://pastebin.com/LyjmsKUw

data.title: Multiple player-palette crash

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
#3725 added the flash palette in the player palette trait, which triggers a duplicate palette error if you have multiple palettes per player. This breaks mods that want to mix RA/C&C/TS units.

The player color flash bits need to be split off into their own trait.

data.title: Service/repair pad should be able to sell units
data.body:
If you want to stay true to the original Red Alert then you should be able to sell units while they are on the repair/servicepad.

If im not mistaken that was an function in atleast RA1.
